node.title: Eight snow sports athletes added to Kiwi contingent for Beijing Winter Olympics
node.description: The New Zealand team for the Beijing Games now stands at 14 athletes
node.content: ["Eight more athletes have been named to represent New Zealand at next month's Beijing Winter Olympics, taking the total Kiwi contingent to 14.", "Fresh from his World Cup silver medal in France earlier this week, 19-year-old Ben Barclay's selection for the Winter Olympics has been confirmed, and will make his first appearance at the Games.", "At just 16 years old, freeski halfpipe competitor Gustav Legnavsky is the youngest Kiwi competitor named to travel to Beijing, and will be joined by 20-year-old Ben Harrington and Miguel Porteous, 22, in the event.", "The trio join medal favourite Nico Porteous as the men's freeski halfpipe hopefuls for New Zealand.", "In the women's freeski halfpipe, 21-year-old Chloe McMillan and 22-year-old Anja Barugh will also travel to Beijing.", "Elsewhere, the duo of 22-year-old Tiarn Collins and 19-year-old Cool Wakushima will both compete in the snowboard slopestyle and big air, joining another medal favourite, Zoi Sadowski-Synott.", "Alice Robinson, Margaux Hackett and Finn Bilous make up the remainder of the New Zealand snow sports team to travel to Beijing.", "Speed skater Peter Michael is the final New Zealander already named for Beijing, taking the total Kiwi team to 14.\u00a0", "\"It is fantastic to have eight additional snow sports athletes selected to the team today\", says Snow Sports NZ chief executive Nic Cavanagh..", "\"These athletes have worked exceptionally hard in a challenging environment and I couldn't be more pleased for them.", "\"We are sending an incredibly strong team to Beijing and I'm really looking forward to seeing them in action on the world's biggest stage\".", "The Beijing Winter Olympics begin on February 4."]
